Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 07:05PM lesley_donna wrote: Kelly, it has gotta be the hardest thing to tell your kids about cancer,  My three are 22, 20 and 5, the older ones know exactly what is happening, the little one, just knows that mum is sick sometimes, but that is it.  I am stage 4 and i know my time is limited so i just squeeze as much time as i can with him, and love him to bits.
Posts.Title: Told The Kiddies.....Sigh KellyC God-is-good

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2010 06:41AM lesley_donna wrote: Pattih, I spend a lot of time in pjs too.  It is all just too hard sometimes.  In December, i was so sick i was sure i would be dead by Jan, but i started abraxane and have had such a good response that all my pain has gone and although im tired as all hell, i feel pretty confident that my time is not up just yet.  Ive done the diaries, the letters and the boxes of stuff for the kids, actually the diaries are ongoing.  My Husband and I and our youngest (6) took five weeks off to travel (Im in Oz) and i made a travel diary, we snorkelled on the Great Barrier Reef, saw whales at Hervey Bay and went to all the theme parks we could.  Im making memories that will last a lifetime, even though i wont, it helps me to feel in control to have these things done, it has been good therapy for me, even though it is hard to do and damn sad.  There are some dark days for sure, but mostly i enjoy my family, love my kids to death and live for the moment.  I hope that you will feel better about things soon (hugs) for you I have given away most of my stuff and hardly buy myself anything new (in case i dont use it) but apart from all that i still live in hope and take every day as it comes.
